distribution.name: archive.zip
distribution.description: Archive containing all the contents of the Credit Card customers dataset

distribution.name: BankChurners.csv
distribution.description:
***********PLEASE IGNORE THE LAST 2 COLUMNS (NAIVE BAYES CLAS...). I SUGGEST TO RATHER DELETE IT BEFORE DOING ANYTHING*************

A business manager of a consumer credit card portfolio is facing the problem of customer attrition. They want to analyze the data to find out the reason behind this and leverage the same to predict customers who are likely to drop off.

field.name: CLIENTNUM
field.description: Client number. Unique identifier for the customer holding the account

field.name: Attrition_Flag
field.description: Internal event (customer activity) variable - if the account is closed then 1 else 0

field.name: Customer_Age
field.description: Demographic variable - Customer's Age in Years

field.name: Gender
field.description: Demographic variable - M=Male, F=Female

field.name: Dependent_count
field.description: Demographic variable - Number of dependents

field.name: Education_Level
field.description: Demographic variable - Educational Qualification of the account holder (example: high school, college graduate, etc.)

field.name: Marital_Status
field.description: Demographic variable - Married, Single, Divorced, Unknown

field.name: Income_Category
field.description: Demographic variable - Annual Income Category of the account holder (< $40K, $40K - 60K, $60K - $80K, $80K-$120K, > $120K, Unknown)

field.name: Card_Category
field.description: Product Variable - Type of Card (Blue, Silver, Gold, Platinum)

field.name: Months_on_book
field.description: Period of relationship with bank

field.name: Total_Relationship_Count
field.description: Total no. of products held by the customer

field.name: Months_Inactive_12_mon
field.description: No. of months inactive in the last 12 months

field.name: Contacts_Count_12_mon
field.description: No. of Contacts in the last 12 months

field.name: Credit_Limit
field.description: Credit Limit on the Credit Card

field.name: Total_Revolving_Bal
field.description: Total Revolving Balance on the Credit Card

field.name: Avg_Open_To_Buy
field.description: Open to Buy Credit Line (Average of last 12 months)

field.name: Total_Amt_Chng_Q4_Q1
field.description: Change in Transaction Amount (Q4 over Q1)

field.name: Total_Trans_Amt
field.description: Total Transaction Amount (Last 12 months)

field.name: Total_Trans_Ct
field.description: Total Transaction Count (Last 12 months)

field.name: Total_Ct_Chng_Q4_Q1
field.description: Change in Transaction Count (Q4 over Q1)

field.name: Avg_Utilization_Ratio
field.description: Average Card Utilization Ratio

field.name: Naive_Bayes_Classifier_Attrition_Flag_Card_Category_Contacts_Count_12_mon_Dependent_count_Education_Level_Months_Inactive_12_mon_1
field.description: Naive Bayes

field.name: Naive_Bayes_Classifier_Attrition_Flag_Card_Category_Contacts_Count_12_mon_Dependent_count_Education_Level_Months_Inactive_12_mon_2
field.description: Naive Bayes

recordSet.name: BankChurners.csv
recordSet.description:
***********PLEASE IGNORE THE LAST 2 COLUMNS (NAIVE BAYES CLAS...). I SUGGEST TO RATHER DELETE IT BEFORE DOING ANYTHING*************

A business manager of a consumer credit card portfolio is facing the problem of customer attrition. They want to analyze the data to find out the reason behind this and leverage the same to predict customers who are likely to drop off.

keywords: subject > people and society > business > finance > banking
subject > people and society > business > finance > lending
subject > people and society > business > e-commerce services
name: Credit Card customers
description:
A manager at the bank is disturbed with more and more customers leaving their credit card services. They would really appreciate if one could predict for them who is gonna get churned so they can proactively go to the customer to provide them better services and turn customers' decisions in the opposite direction

I got this dataset from a website with the URL as https://leaps.analyttica.com/home. I have been using this for a while to get datasets and accordingly work on them to produce fruitful results. The site explains how to solve a particular business problem. 

Now, this dataset consists of 10,000 customers mentioning their age, salary, marital_status, credit card limit, credit card category, etc. There are nearly 18 features. 

We have only 16.07% of customers who have churned. Thus, it's a bit difficult to train our model to predict churning customers.
